column4: Hey guys I was wondering what is the best way to configure ubuntu, Im a noob and was wondering how do I find out if everyting is working
one way that I have noticed is to go to System->Administration->System Log and see if errors are showing up there.
I have an Edubuntu system that keeps trying to start some fan somewhere.  Quite annoying.
is that related to an error you are getting?
oh i was just curious how I know everything is working, cause in device manager, some stuff says the name but for capabilities it says unknown
oh ok.  cups has to do with printing from my limited knowledge.
is there more info in the error ?
I've installed on an early P4 Intel motherboard/chip and so far everything is running pretty good.
yea it says creating a missing directory, and then exactly what I told you.
are you running from the live cd or did you do the install ?
unfortunately with my knowledge at this time, i don't know that there is a single location to tell if everything is good to go.
I just know this computer runs fine with whatever I've thrown at it, and my Edubuntu Server has that darn fan error message in System Log. :-(
another question do you know how to use wireshark
I haven't used that one.  My installs are all desktop computers connected via ethernet.
